page.title: 13LORD COLERIDGE
page.content:
An interview with Lord Coleridge at Chanter House:
Three girls and two boys went to Chanters House to interview Lord Coleridge. When they got there they found Lord Coleridge in the kitchen. He took them down to the cellar and told them about a secret passage which led to Cadhay and the church but has now been bricked up. Lord Coleridge took them upstairs and they came to a door which had Cromwell and Fairfast engraved on it. They went inside and saw a large table and on the beams around the room were painted small pictures. The children began to interview Lord Coleridge. They learned that the title was first given to the Colridge family in 1873 when a member of the family was made Lord Chief Justice of England
